children.value:
A long chain, with mass per unit length 
$\valuedef{\lambda }{1}{kg\,  m\sup {-1}}$
, is suspended vertically above a table by one end. The chain is allowed to fall, but held so that it always falls at 
$\valuedef{v}{5}{m\,  s\sup {-1}}$
.

answer.value:
The force exerted down on the table is 
$\valuedef{F}{270}{N}$

children.value:
After 
$\valuedef{t}{5}{s}$
 what is the force exerted downwards on the table?

Now a chain with length 
$\valuedef{l}{5}{m}$
 is held above a table by one end, then allowed to fall freely under gravity.

answer.value:
The total force on the table as the end of the chain hits the table is 
$\valuedef{F}{147}{N}$
, three times the total weight of the chain.

children.value: The moment the last piece of the chain touches the table, what is the total force being exerted on the table?
